recipe.ingredients: 6 large eggs, 1/4 cup non-fat milk, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 cups sliced mushrooms, 2 cups fresh spinach, 1 small onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 cup shredded low-fat cheddar cheese, Fresh herbs (like parsley or chives), chopped, for garnish
recipe.directions: Preheat the oven to 375 F. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, non-fat milk, salt, and pepper until well combined. Set aside.,In a 10-inch oven-proof skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and mushrooms and saut√© until the onions are translucent and mushrooms are browned, about 5-7 minutes.,Add spinach to the skillet and cook until just wilted, about 1-2 minutes. Spread the veggies evenly across the bottom of the skillet.,Pour the egg mixture over the veggies, covering them evenly. Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top. Let cook without stirring for about 4-5 minutes until the eggs start to set.,Place the skillet in the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until frittata is puffed and golden, and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.,Garnish with fresh herbs before serving. Cut into wedges and serve warm.
recipe.nutrition: Calories 900 (Total), Calories per serving 225 (Assuming 4 servings), Total fat 60g, Saturated fat 15g, Trans fat 0g, Monounsaturated fat 20g, Cholesterol 1,220mg, Sodium 1,560mg, Total carbohydrate 24g, Dietary fiber 5g, Total sugars 14g, Protein 78g
